name: coeliac
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a person who has coeliac disease, a medical condition which means they cannot digest gluten (= a substance found in some grains) well: If you are a coeliac, all the dishes marked GF are suitable as they are gluten-free. Coeliacs have to avoid wheat, rye, oats, and barley.
[ U ] informal short for
coeliac disease : It can help to talk to other people with coeliac. The tests showed she had coeliac.
More examplesFewer examplesAs my wife is a coeliac, I use a gluten free plain flour. For a coeliac, the menu wasn't great as every dish seemed to feature pasta or pastry. No one else that I know has coeliac.

having or relating to coeliac disease, a medical condition which means someone cannot digest gluten (= a substance found in some grains) well: The study looked at a group of coeliac patients. He said he was vegetarian and coeliac.
anatomy
  specialized relating to the abdomen (= the lower part of the body containing the stomach, bowels, etc.): There appears to be greater blood flow to the coeliac artery in these patients. The coeliac trunk was located by scrolling down on the CT images.
